document_data.name: Maurice's malfeasance
document_data.mainbody: '''''Maurice's malfeasance''''' was an [[alteration]] [[spell]], developed by the [[Earth (element)|earth]] [[elementalist]] [[Maurice Stone]] in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]], that put a damaging effect on all manner of [[magic]] within an area.<ref name=SC-p27" />
document_data.Effects:
When cast this spell created an area of effect, covering a radius of {{SIAdj|150|yard|long=yes}}. Within that area of effect all [[magic item]]s, magical abilities, and [[spell]]s would cause harm to their wielder or [[spellcaster]] upon use. In the case of magical weapons, harm would only be incurred after hurting someone with the weapon.<ref name=SC-p27" />

The duration of this spell and the distance at which it could be cast varied with the skill of its spellcaster, with the lowest possible values being 7 hours and a distance of {{SI|14|yards|long=yes}}.<ref name=SC-p27" /><ref group="note" name="power">The duration of the spell is equal to the caster's level and its distance is equal to {{SI|100|yard}}/caster level.
document_data.Components: Casting this spell required only [[somatic]] and [[verbal component]]s.<ref name=SC-p27" />
document_data.History: In the mid–14{{th}} century DR, Maurice Stone had this spell activate within his lair when a group of [[adventurer]]s confronted him over the kidnapping of [[Lauren DeVillars]].<ref name=SC-p27" />
